item.title: A New Protocol Gemini
item.description: First, we need to figure out What is protocol? What is protocol? Internet protocol is way that information gets to you. Now used protocol is HTTP/HTTPS. Which is acronym for Hypertext Transfer Protocol/Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure. What is Gemini? Gemini is a new internet protocol which: Is heavier than gopher Is lighter than the web Will not replace either Strives for maximum power to weight ratio Takes user privacy very seriously How to access Gemini network?

Which is acronym for Hypertext Transfer Protocol/Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure. What is Gemini? item.title: Bye, Simplenote! Welcome, Logseq!
item.description: I hope this is my final settle, I switched from Simplenote to Logseq. I switched from it beacuse of it’s minimal features. It doesn’t have formating, for example. But, my main reason was that i cant really organise my notes with tags. I like to link them. So that’s where Logseq comes in play, I love Obsidian (but it’s not open-source, for those who doesn’t know). So I was happy when I found out about Logseq, it’s really nice note-taking app.

item.title: Finally Settled on SimpleNote
item.description: In the last post, I talked about that I want to switch to note-taking app like Obsidian and that it’s open-source. I finnaly settled on SimpleNote for it’s simplicity. I watched video from Tiego Forte which was really good, I recommend it to anyone who wants to find his note-taking app.

item.title: Finding Open Source Note Taking
item.description: Right now, I’m using Obsidian as my note taking app. But, there is only one problem with it and that problem is that it’s not open-source. This shouldn’t be very concerning, because if you don’t use Obsidian Sync feature and save your notes on HDD. Today, I searched for open-source note taking app like Obsidian. I only found LogSeq which is really great app, but it’s not for me really. I like simplicity of Obsidian and when I use LogSeq I really feel that it’s cluttered.

item.title: Finding Open Source Note Taking
item.description: Right now, I’m using Obsidian as my note taking app. But, there is only one problem with it and that problem is that it’s not open-source. This shouldn’t be very concerning, because if you don’t use Obsidian Sync feature and save your notes on HDD. Today, I searched for open-source note taking app like Obsidian. I only found LogSeq which is really great app, but it’s not for me really. I like simplicity of Obsidian and when I use LogSeq I really feel that it’s cluttered.
About Hi, my name is Luka, I live in Serbia and I’m 14 years old. I really love programming, linux, basically everything in the world.
Contact If you want to contact me: Email: luka@youshitsune.me Discord: JovanovicLuka#1700 Instagram: @jluka1 I’m gonna answer you on Discord or Email before than on Instagram.

Log 1 Aug, 2022 Today, It was really interesting meeting other devs on KAMACHO discord server. They found it incredible that I code, beacuse I’m only 14. I really recommend Open Source Hub discord server (i found it little ironic that server that talks about open-source is on closed-source software), there I met also one guy that’s only 13. But, he already has server for helping people with coding. He asked me if I want to join and I replied that I would love to join.
